feed.title: Engaging Indian States
feed.subtitle: Engaging Indian States is a comprehensive tool for businesses, researchers, policymakers, & journalists who seek to engage with India’s state governments.

entry.title: West Bengal to get its first super-critical thermalpower plant

link.title: West Bengal to get its first super-critical thermalpower plant

entry.content: The state-run Power Finance Corp has sanctioned financial assistance of $408.5 million for West Bengal’s first super critical thermal power project in Murshidabad district. West Bengal Power Development Corporation Ltd will expand the Sagardighi Thermal Power Station with a new 660 MW unit.
entry.summary: The state-run Power Finance Corp has sanctioned financial assistance of $408.5 million for West Bengal’s first super critical thermal power project in Murshidabad district. West Bengal Power Development Corporation Ltd will expand the Sagardighi Thermal Power Station with a new 660 MW unit.

entry.title: Telangana presents budget for 2017-18
entry.content: State Finance Minister Etala Rajender presented a $22.4 billion budget for 2017-18. The budget increased allocation for the agriculture and power sectors as well as various welfare measures. Rajender said Telangana is projected to achieve growth of over 10.1 percent during the current fiscal.
entry.summary: State Finance Minister Etala Rajender presented a $22.4 billion budget for 2017-18. The budget increased allocation for the agriculture and power sectors as well as various welfare measures. Rajender said Telangana is projected to achieve growth of over 10.1 percent during the current fiscal.

entry.title: Second unit of Kudankulam reaches full generation capacity

link.title: Second unit of Kudankulam reaches full generation capacity

entry.content: Unit 2 of the Kudankulam nuclear power plant reached its full capacity of 1,000 MW, becoming the second nuclear reactor in the country to generate 1,000MW.
entry.summary: Unit 2 of the Kudankulam nuclear power plant reached its full capacity of 1,000 MW, becoming the second nuclear reactor in the country to generate 1,000MW.

entry.title: Over 90 percent of land for Pavagada solar park acquired in Karnataka

link.title: Over 90 percent of land for Pavagada solar park acquired in Karnataka

entry.content: The Karnataka Solar Power Development Corporation has managed to acquire 12,000 of the 13,000 acres identified for the Pavagada solar park, allowing it to start infrastructure work. The state hopes to generate around 2,700 megawatts (MW) from the park by the end of 2018. The park is being developed by the Karnataka Solar Power Development Corp. Ltd., a joint venture between Karnataka Renewable Energy Development Ltd and the Solar Energy Corp. of India.
entry.summary: The Karnataka Solar Power Development Corporation has managed to acquire 12,000 of the 13,000 acres identified for the Pavagada solar park, allowing it to start infrastructure work. The state hopes to generate around 2,700 megawatts (MW) from the park by the end of 2018. The park is being developed by the Karnataka Solar Power Development Corp. Ltd., a joint venture between Karnataka Renewable Energy Development Ltd and the Solar Energy Corp. of India.

entry.title: NTPC commissions solar project in Rajasthan

link.title: NTPC commissions solar project in Rajasthan

entry.content: The National Thermal Power Corporation announced commissioning of a 45 MW capacity solar plant at Bhadla in Rajasthan, taking the total installed capacity of the project to 160 MW.
entry.summary: The National Thermal Power Corporation announced commissioning of a 45 MW capacity solar plant at Bhadla in Rajasthan, taking the total installed capacity of the project to 160 MW.

entry.title: New regulations in western Madhya Pradesh for getting power connection approvals

link.title: New regulations in western Madhya Pradesh for getting power connection approvals

entry.content: The Madhya Pradesh Paschim Kshetra Vidyut Vitaran Company Ltd. will make it compulsory for both commercial and residential consumers to submit a photograph while applying for a new power connection. Contractors installing supply lines will have to submit a report on how much supply is needed for each connection. The moves are meant to control power loss and avoid cases of overloading.
entry.summary: The Madhya Pradesh Paschim Kshetra Vidyut Vitaran Company Ltd. will make it compulsory for both commercial and residential consumers to submit a photograph while applying for a new power connection. Contractors installing supply lines will have to submit a report on how much supply is needed for each connection. The moves are meant to control power loss and avoid cases of overloading.

entry.title: India’s largest floating solar power plant starts generation of power

link.title: India's largest floating solar power plant starts generation of power

entry.content: The National Thermal Power Corporation began power generation from India’s largest floating solar power plant at Kayamkulam. The 100 kilowatt peak floating solar generation plant was indigenously developed at the Rajiv Gandhi Combined Cycle Power Plant in Kerala’s Kayamkulam district, the company said.
entry.summary: The National Thermal Power Corporation began power generation from India’s largest floating solar power plant at Kayamkulam. The 100 kilowatt peak floating solar generation plant was indigenously developed at the Rajiv Gandhi Combined Cycle Power Plant in Kerala’s Kayamkulam district, the company said.

entry.title: Delhi to modernize its electrical grid with support from Nokia

link.title: Delhi to modernize its electrical grid with support from Nokia

entry.content: Tata Power Delhi Distribution Ltd (Tata Power-DDL) has joined with telecom equipment maker Nokia to modernize electrical grids. Nokia has provided Tata Power-DDL with an Internet protocol/multiprotocol label switching network to support the management of its electrical grids in north and north-west Delhi.
entry.summary: Tata Power Delhi Distribution Ltd (Tata Power-DDL) has joined with telecom equipment maker Nokia to modernize electrical grids. Nokia has provided Tata Power-DDL with an Internet protocol/multiprotocol label switching network to support the management of its electrical grids in north and north-west Delhi.

entry.title: 50 MW wind afrm to come up at Amba in Madhya Pradesh

link.title: 50 MW wind afrm to come up at Amba in Madhya Pradesh

entry.content: Renewable energy firm Gamesa announced that it has secured an order from Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services for a 50 MW wind farm project at Amba, Madhya Pradesh.
entry.summary: Renewable energy firm Gamesa announced that it has secured an order from Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services for a 50 MW wind farm project at Amba, Madhya Pradesh.

entry.title: Tripura to increase its power supply to eastern Bangaldesh

link.title: Tripura to increase its power supply to eastern Bangaldesh

entry.content: Tripura will supply eastern Bangladesh with a further 60 MW of electricity, beyond the 100 MW it has been providing since March 2016.
entry.summary: Tripura will supply eastern Bangladesh with a further 60 MW of electricity, beyond the 100 MW it has been providing since March 2016.
